Student Affairs Goals & Outcomes                       Links and Resources                       Request an Assessment                                                                        Research and Assessment             The Office of Research and Assessment for Student Affairs (ORASA) provides leadership and vision in establishing and managing the Division of Student Affairs program evaluation and research efforts to support long-term planning focusing on policy, practice, and program development.   As a part of this charge, a variety of consultation is available for program evaluation, quantitative and qualitative research methods, learning outcomes assessment, data collection, and data analysis and presentation.   ORASA collaborates with various offices, administrators and faculty, including teams, committees, task forces, and work groups, on student life based fact-finding, policy development and implementation.                Get in Touch            Kimmel Center for University Life, 60 Washington Square South, Suite 601, NYC   Phone: 212.998.4409 or 212.998.4204 | Fax: 212.995.3506                  Links              Request an assessment from our office     Explore our division's goals and outcomes                                                                                     Sonia DeLuca Fernández       Director of Research and Assessment  212.998.4409   sdf4@nyu.edu                                                                  Student Affairs      Marc Wais                           Research and Assessment      Sonia DeLuca Fernández                                                            NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. TSS can discuss security precautions and explain how to implement security policies within your department. Find out more >>      Handling restricted data ? We can assist your dept. with securing restricted data and offer strong security recommendations for free . Request assistance >>                   Overview    In order to protect sensitive data, you need to examine your existing business processes. Review your existing business processes which request or process sensitive data in order to assess the state of data security.     Checklist    Look at your existing business processes which request or process sensitive data and answer the following questions:     Based on the Data Classification Table, is my department collecting "Restricted Data"? ( For more information on the different categories of sensitive data, review the ITS Data Classifcation Table here )     How is the data being used?   Is it necessary to performing a business function?   Who within my group needs access to these data?   How long do we need to keep these data?      Make a plan for restricting collection and storage to meet the "minimum necessary" standard for access to sensitive data. In other words: 1) One only collects the minimum that is required for a business process 2) Access to that data is only granted to the smallest number of employees required 3) The data is kept for the shortest period of time possible before it is properly disposed of.    Once you have completed this process, begin reviewing where data is stored and collected.   Step 2 - Reviewing Data Storage & Collection >>>    Page last reviewed: May 20, 2011

GOALS              Team members will be reconstituting, refraiming, or making explicit what their unit is doing to assess their program.                 EXPECTATIONS              Each unit should assess at least one learning outcome, associated with appropriate goals, by the end of the semester.                 MEMBERS              The team will be comprised of no fewer than one constituent from each of the units in the Division of Student Affairs.                       Team Members           ATHLETICS, INTRAMURALS, AND RECREATION       Dominick Ciaccia     Stephanie Pryor     CENTER FOR MULTICULTURAL EDUCATION AND PROGRAMS     Selima Jumarali   Paulina Abaunza     CENTER FOR STUDENT ACTIVITIES, LEADERSHIP, AND SERVICE     Jessica Brown Guerrero     Allison Harris     LGBTQ STUDENT CENTER     Celiany Rivera-Velázquez     Chris Woods       MOSES CENTER FOR STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES     Mary Liz McNamara   Sonia Ajwani     OFFICE OF COMMUNITY STANDARDS AND COMPLIANCE     Jill Creighton     OFFICE OF GLOBAL PROGRAMS     Alejandro Martí   Maria Christodoulou   Kate Bruce       OFFICE OF GLOBAL SERVICES     Sarah Willyard   Tracie Masek     OFFICE OF GLOBAL SPIRITUAL LIFE     Ariel Ennis       OFFICE OF INTERACTIVE MEDIA     Guido Ditto       OFFICE OF RESIDENTIAL LIFE AND HOUSING SERVICES     Kerri Smith     Ali Guokas       OFFICE OF THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR STUDENT AFFAIRS     Kyle Stockwell       STUDENT HEALTH CENTER     Allison Smith     STUDENT RESOURCE CENTER     Zach Harrell   Long Wu       UNIVERSITY PROGRAMS     Kristin Balicki     WASSERMAN CENTER FOR CAREER DEVELOPMENT     Heather Morgan   Nicole Isenhour                         Learn Something!
